did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: The Kinder Institute for Urban Research records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: The Kinder Institute for Urban Research

did.abstract: These records consist of materials related to the administration of The Kinder Institute for Urban Research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Kinder Institute for Urban Resarch was created in 2010 with a $15 million gift from Houston philanthropists Richard and Nancy Kinder. It is a multidiscplinary think-and-do tank at Rice University that focuses on"urban issues in Houston, the American Sun Belt and around the world."
Dr. Stephen Klineberg is Founding Director of the Kinder Institution from 2010 to present. William Fulton has been the directory since fall 2014.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: These records contain Kinder Institute Advisory Board meeting materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Kinder Institute for Urban Research records, 2018, UA414, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center.
